title: Bug 21706 BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: When using the CLDC version of SWT, a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown at the line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, 'windowProc', 4);'. This error is not defined in the CLDC class libraries, which causes a problem in the CLDC version of SWT. This issue only occurs when verifying or using jxeLink. The Eclipse compiler and Sun's compiler do not show any compilation errors for this line.
EB: Change the line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, 'windowProc', 4);' to 'static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), 'windowProc', 4);'.
SR:
1. Open the file 'org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil' in the win32 version of SWT.
2. Locate the line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, 'windowProc', 4);'.
3. Replace the line with 'static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), 'windowProc', 4);'.
4. Save the file and rebuild the project.
5. Test the application on the CLDC version of SWT to confirm that the NoClassDefFoundError is no longer thrown.
